title: Got the DIY Bug? Enduro Releases New Hub Tool and (More) Affordable Press Kits
content:
If you’re venturing into DIY bike repair and are looking to level up your tool game, Enduro Bearings just announced an all-new hub-bearing remover tool kit that pairs with its service kits. While they are still not what people could consider “cheap” by any means, these professional-grade toolsets do offer savings over the previously available systems. Let’s check ’em out…

$349 – BRT-060-Z

The DIY home starter’s kit. A Linear-Press Bearing service toolset including quick-release Zip-Nnut – designed to service all hub and suspension bearing applications. You can expand the kit with two key offerings below.

This kit includes two length press rods sized specifically for hub or suspension applications, a pair of interchangeable Liner Quick Handles along with a full complement of bearing guides and receiver cups to ensure efficient and accurate bearing removal and installation.

$249 – BRT-040

Toolkit for BB bearing removal and installation, and hub bearing removal. For use with BRT-060 (above) and BRT-050 bearing presses.

This kit expands upon the functionality of the BRT-060 and BRT-050 bearing presses to allow for the gentle removal and installation of BB bearings and hub bearings by utilizing the nut and threaded rod from the bearing press to press the bearing from the component. This is ideal for bearings like stainless steel and XD15 that can be removed and cleaned over and over again, should they become rough and gritty with dirt. There’s an innovating disc brake stand-off to ensure your disc centerlock and 6 bolt interfaces are unscathed.

$149 – BRT-040-29mm

Toolkit for BB bearing removal and installation for 29mm (SRAM DUB) BBs. For use with BRT-060 and BRT-050 bearing presses.

This kit expands upon the functionality of the BRT-060 and BRT-050 bearing presses to allow for the gentle removal and installation of BB bearings and hub bearings by utilizing the nut and threaded rod from the bearing press to press the bearing from the component. This is ideal for bearings like stainless steel and XD15 that can be removed and cleaned over and over again, should they become rough and gritty with dirt.

See more tool kits and press tools at Enduro Bearings.
